data.event: The land at Heidelberg was sold by crown auction in 1838, making it one of the earliest rural allotments; Melbourne was founded only three years earlier.

event.title: was founded only three years earlier

data.event: The land at Heidelberg was sold by crown auction in 1838, making it one of the earliest rural allotments; Melbourne was founded only three years earlier.
By 1840, Warringal had been established as a surveyed township, the name referring to an Aboriginal term for eagle's nest.

event.title: was reached by track from Melbourne via North Fitzroy, and in 1841

data.event: When it was settled, Heidelberg was reached by track from Melbourne via North Fitzroy, and in 1841 the Heidelberg Road Trust was formed.

event.title: built his gothic Banyule Homestead in 1846

data.event: Cattle overlander Joseph Hawdon built his gothic Banyule Homestead in 1846, overlooking the Yarra Valley.
